availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Blankenship (Macon County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Macon County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Macon County, Tennessee native. Son of Isham Blankenship and Sarah Blankenship. Married to Elizabeth Blankenship. Father of John J. Blankenship, Washington Wolford Blankenship, and Sarah F. Blankenship. Farmer in Macon County, Tennessee, in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from October 11, 1861 to February 19, 1862. Served in the 1st Tennessee Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from December 10, 1863 to January 22, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Tennessee, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M395, Roll 0126.
